name: Weeds
original_description: A bunch of obnoxious weeds.

name: Stone
original_description: A useful material when broken with the Pickaxe.

name: Stone
original_description: A useful material when chopped with the axe.

name: Wild Horseradish
unsettling_description: A hotly pungent, fleshy root. Crushing or grinding it releases the flavor and heat.
original_description: A spicy root found in the spring.

name: Daffodil
original_description: A traditional spring flower that makes a nice gift.

name: Leek
unsettling_description: Some wild animal marked its territory on this one.
original_description: A tasty relative of the onion.

name: Dandelion
unsettling_description: The leaves are a powerful diuretic; eating them increases urine production.
original_description: Not the prettiest flower, but the leaves make a good salad.

name: Parsnip
unsettling_description: It has all the flavor of a bleached, long-dead carrot.
original_description: A spring tuber closely related to the carrot. It has an earthy taste and is full of nutrients.

name: Lumber
original_description: A versatile resource used for building and fuel.

name: Emerald
unsettling_description: This gem is thought to guard against memory loss. A thoughtful gift for divorcees.
original_description: A precious stone with a brilliant green color.

name: Aquamarine
unsettling_description: Thought to protect against seasickness and tragic sailing accidents.
original_description: A shimmery blue-green gem.

name: Ruby
unsettling_description: The "pigeon's blood" variety of this gem is its most sought-after color variant.
original_description: A precious stone that is sought after for its rich color and beautiful luster.

name: Amethyst
unsettling_description: Some sources suggest that this stone is used to stabilize mental disorders.
original_description: A purple variant of quartz.

name: Topaz
unsettling_description: When worn as a necklace, this gemstone is believed to drive away sadness.
original_description: Fairly common but still prized for its beauty.

name: Jade
unsettling_description: In many cultures, this stone has a strong association with the dead.
original_description: A pale green ornamental stone.

name: Trimmed Lucky Purple Shorts
unsettling_description: The mayor's used silk shorts. They look better on you than on Marnie's floor.
original_description: Purple silk shorts trimmed in luxurious gold...

name: Diamond
unsettling_description: This one seems to be clear of blood.
original_description: A rare and valuable gem.

name: Prismatic Shard
original_description: A very rare and powerful substance with unknown origins.

name: Cave Carrot
unsettling_description: A dirtier variety of carrot. Fulfills many needs of a miner.
original_description: A starchy snack found in caves. It helps miners work longer.

name: Secret Note
original_description: It's old and crumpled, but if you look closely you can make out the details...

name: Quartz
original_description: A clear crystal commonly found in caves and mines.

name: Fire Quartz
original_description: A glowing red crystal commonly found near hot lava.

name: Frozen Tear
unsettling_description: The last remnant of some long forgotten creature.
original_description: A crystal fabled to be the frozen tears of a yeti.

name: Earth Crystal
unsettling_description: An item commonly gifted by cheapskates.
original_description: A resinous substance found near the surface.

name: Coconut
unsettling_description: Covered in rough hair, it provides both milk and meat.
original_description: A seed of the coconut palm. It has many culinary uses.

name: Cactus Fruit
unsettling_description: You'd have to spend a long time under the desert sun to consider this fruit edible.
original_description: The sweet fruit of the prickly pear cactus.

name: Sap
original_description: A fluid obtained from trees.

name: Torch
unsettling_description: Flickers suddenly from time to time, even when there is no breeze.
original_description: Provides a modest amount of light.

name: Spirit Torch
original_description: It's unclear where the blue color comes from...

name: Dwarf Scroll I
unsettling_description: A scroll written in an ancient language... it probably isn't calling for genocide of surface dwellers, right?
original_description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a red bow.

name: Dwarf Scroll II
unsettling_description: A scroll written in an ancient language, describing a species that never expected to become endangered.
original_description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a green ribbon.

name: Dwarf Scroll III
unsettling_description: A scroll written in an ancient language, the writer unaware their days were numbered.
original_description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a blue rope.

name: Dwarf Scroll IV
unsettling_description: A scroll written in an ancient language. Did they know the end was coming?
original_description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a golden chain.

name: Chipped Amphora
unsettling_description: Hopefully not used in any sacrificial rituals.
original_description: An ancient vessel made of ceramic material. Used to transport both dry and wet goods.

name: Arrowhead
original_description: A crudely fashioned point used for hunting.

name: Lost Book
original_description: Writings from a wide variety of time periods.

name: Ancient Doll
unsettling_description: When left out of sight, this doll is rumored to change position on its own.
original_description: An ancient doll covered in grime. This doll may have been used as a toy, a decoration, or a prop in some kind of ritual.

name: Elvish Jewelry
unsettling_description: Legend says they are enchanted to be as warm as their owners. It's cold to the touch.
original_description: Dirty but still beautiful. On the side is a flowing script thought by some to be the ancient language of the elves. No Elvish bones have ever been found.

name: Chewing Stick
unsettling_description: You can still taste what the last person who used it had for lunch.
original_description: Ancient people chewed on these to keep their teeth clean.

name: Ornamental Fan
original_description: This exquisute fan most likely belonged to a noblewoman. Historians believe that the valley was a popular sixth-era vacation spot for the wealthy.

name: Dinosaur Egg
unsettling_description: Perhaps it can still hatch... what could go wrong?
original_description: A giant dino egg... The entire shell is still intact!

name: Rare Disc
original_description: A heavy black disc studded with peculiar red stones. When you hold it, you're overwhelmed with a feeling of dread.

name: Ancient Sword
unsettling_description: The sword may be in bad shape, but it has far outlived its owner.
original_description: It's the remains of an ancient sword. Most of the blade has turned to rust, but the hilt is very finely crafted.

name: Rusty Spoon
unsettling_description: Despite its normal shape, I wouldn't use it for breakfast.
original_description: A plain old spoon, probably ten years old. Not very interesting.

name: Rusty Spur
original_description: An old spur that was once attached to a cowboy's boot. People must have been raising animals in this area for many generations.

name: Rusty Cog
unsettling_description: It reminds you of your old workplace, somehow.
original_description: A well preserved cog that must have been part of some ancient machine. This could be dwarven technology.

name: Chicken Statue
unsettling_description: A mummified chicken in pristine condition. When you shake it you can hear small bones rattling inside.
original_description: It's a statue of a chicken on a bronze base. The ancient people of this area must have been very fond of chickens.

name: Ancient Seed
original_description: It's a dry old seed from some ancient plant. By all appearances it's long since dead...

name: Prehistoric Tool
original_description: Some kind of gnarly old digging tool.

name: Dried Starfish
unsettling_description: Some believe that starfish scream as the sun dries them out, but only fish can hear their piercing cries.
original_description: A starfish from the primordial ocean. It's an unusually pristine specimen!

name: Anchor
original_description: It may have belonged to ancient pirates.

name: Glass Shards
original_description: A mixture of glass shards smoothed by centuries of ocean surf. These could have belonged to an ancient mosaic or necklace.

name: Bone Flute
unsettling_description: Imagine blowing some ancient creature's dirty, bacteria-filled tibia. Bone flute!
original_description: It's a prehistoric wind instrument carved from an animal's bone. It produces an eerie tone.

name: Prehistoric Handaxe
original_description: One of the earliest tools employed by humans. This "crude" tool was created by striking one rock with another to form a sharp edge.

name: Dwarvish Helm
unsettling_description: It's sturdy, but even the best armor didn't prevent their near-extinction.
original_description: It's one of the helmets commonly worn by dwarves. The thick metal plating protects them from falling debris and stalactites.

name: Dwarf Gadget
unsettling_description: The strange crystalline screen stays lit, but shows only static.
original_description: It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarves. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works.

name: Ancient Drum
unsettling_description: Looks like skin stretched over bone. Nice sound though.
original_description: It's a drum made from wood and animal skin. It has a low, reverberating tone.

name: Golden Mask
original_description: A creepy golden mask probably used in an ancient magic ritual. A socket in the forehead contains a large purple gemstone.

name: Golden Relic
original_description: It's a golden slab with heiroglyphs and pictures emblazoned onto the front.

name: Strange Doll
unsettling_description: It just wants to spend your whole life with you.

name: Strange Doll
unsettling_description: What a beautiful smile you have.

name: Pufferfish
unsettling_description: Expands to stab with poisonous spines when threatened. Its cousin, the pufferchick, is much more friendly.
original_description: Inflates when threatened.

name: Anchovy
unsettling_description: Suspected of ruining many a soup.
original_description: A small silver fish found in the ocean.

name: Tuna
original_description: A large fish that lives in the ocean.

name: Sardine
original_description: A common ocean fish.

name: Bream
original_description: A fairly common river fish that becomes active at night.

name: Largemouth Bass
original_description: A popular fish that lives in lakes.

name: Smallmouth Bass
original_description: A freshwater fish that is very sensitive to pollution.

name: Rainbow Trout
original_description: A freshwater trout with colorful markings.

name: Salmon
unsettling_description: In fall, these fish swim miles upstream and die just to mate.
original_description: Swims upstream to lay its eggs.

name: Walleye
original_description: A freshwater fish caught at night.

name: Perch
original_description: A freshwater fish of the winter.

name: Carp
original_description: A common pond fish.

name: Catfish
unsettling_description: This ugly bottom-feeder will eat just about anything.
original_description: An uncommon fish found in streams.

name: Pike
original_description: A freshwater fish that's difficult to catch.

name: Sunfish
original_description: A common river fish.

name: Red Mullet
original_description: Long ago these were kept as pets.

name: Herring
original_description: A common ocean fish.

name: Eel
unsettling_description: Wriggles and writhes just like some long organ.
original_description: A long, slippery little fish.

name: Octopus
unsettling_description: The tentacles give a tingly, suckling sensation.
original_description: A mysterious and intelligent creature.

name: Red Snapper
original_description: A popular fish with a nice red color.

name: Squid
unsettling_description: These soft-bodied animals are known to be incredibly intelligent. Still, delicious.
original_description: A deep sea creature that can grow to enormous size.

name: Seaweed
original_description: It can be used in cooking.

name: Green Algae
unsettling_description: The consistency of cold snot, with the occasional satisfying crunch.
original_description: It's really slimy.

name: Sea Cucumber
original_description: A slippery, slimy creature found on the ocean floor.

name: Super Cucumber
original_description: A rare, purple variety of sea cucumber.

name: Ghostfish
unsettling_description: Should have left it in the water...
original_description: A pale, blind fish found in underground lakes.

name: White Algae
unsettling_description: It leaves a fragrant white film on your hands.
original_description: It's super slimy.

name: Stonefish
original_description: A bizarre fish that's shaped like a brick.

name: Crimsonfish
original_description: Lives deep in the ocean but likes to lay its eggs in the warm summer water.

name: Angler
unsettling_description: This eerie fish is known for the sexual parasitism of its disturbing reproductive cycle.
original_description: Uses a bioluminescent dangler to attract prey.

name: Ice Pip
unsettling_description: A frozen, zombified fish. Don't let it bite you. You might be able to use it as a weapon, though.
original_description: A rare fish that thrives in extremely cold conditions.

name: Lava Eel
unsettling_description: Legend says it survives by feeding off the remains of travelers who drown in the mines.
original_description: It can somehow survive in pools of red-hot lava.

name: Legend
unsettling_description: The grandfather of all largemouth bass in the lake, now torn from his home.
original_description: The king of all fish! They said he'd never be caught.

name: Sandfish
unsettling_description: It hides using camouflage. Sometimes you can see the sand move as it waits for prey.
original_description: It tries to hide using camouflage.

name: Scorpion Carp
unsettling_description: The unholy union of a scorpion and a carp. Keep hands away from tailfin!
original_description: It's like a regular carp but with a sharp stinger.

name: Treasure Chest
unsettling_description: Many of the coins inside are stained an ugly dark red, almost black.
original_description: Wow, it's loaded with treasure! This is sure to fetch a good price.

name: Joja Cola
unsettling_description: Food safety authorities have questioned the blue chemical used to color this drink.
original_description: The flagship product of Joja corporation.

name: Trash
original_description: It's junk.

name: Driftwood
unsettling_description: The weathered remnant of a drowned tree.
original_description: A piece of wood from the sea.

name: Broken Glasses
original_description: It looks like someone lost their glasses. They're busted.

name: Broken CD
unsettling_description: Faded blue marker on one side mentions "blackmail", but the rest is indiscernible.
original_description: It's a JojaNet 2.0 trial CD. They must've made a billion of these things.

name: Soggy Newspaper
unsettling_description: Filled with propaganda and word vomit. Worthless.
original_description: This is trash.

name: Egg
unsettling_description: A regular white egg. Fresh from a chicken's cloaca!
original_description: A regular white chicken egg.

name: Large Egg
unsettling_description: An uncommonly large white egg. Can you imagine how the chicken must have stretched?
original_description: It's an uncommonly large white egg!

name: Hay
unsettling_description: Delicious grass corpses for your animal friends.
original_description: Dried grass used as animal food.

name: Egg
unsettling_description: A regular brown egg. Fresh from a chicken's cloaca!
original_description: A regular brown chicken egg.

name: Large Egg
unsettling_description: An uncommonly large brown egg. Can you imagine how the chicken must have stretched?
original_description: It's an uncommonly large brown egg!

name: Milk
unsettling_description: A jug of cow tiddy juice. Yum.
original_description: A jug of cow's milk.

name: Large Milk
unsettling_description: Voluminous secretions from a bulging cow udder.
original_description: A large jug of cow's milk.

name: Green Bean
original_description: A juicy little bean with a cool, crisp snap.

name: Cauliflower
original_description: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.

name: Ornate Necklace
original_description: A fancy necklace found in the water outside of the bath house. It's still wet...

name: Potato
unsettling_description: It doesn't seem like much, but you'd be glad of it in a famine.
original_description: A widely cultivated tuber.

name: Fried Egg
unsettling_description: Mmm~ unborn chicken cooked in crushed nut juice.
original_description: Sunny-side up.

name: Omelet
unsettling_description: Fluffy, congealed cow AND chicken juices. Are you gonna eat that?
original_description: It's super fluffy.

name: Salad
unsettling_description: Assorted dismembered plant materials, tossed with a flavorful dressing.
original_description: A healthy garden salad.

name: Cheese Cauliflower
unsettling_description: Plants taste better with curdled cow juice on them.
original_description: It smells great!

name: Baked Fish
original_description: Baked fish on a bed of herbs.

name: Parsnip Soup
original_description: It's fresh and hearty.

name: Vegetable Medley
original_description: This is very nutritious.

name: Complete Breakfast
unsettling_description: This would make a very satisfying last meal.
original_description: You'll feel ready to take on the world!

name: Fried Calamari
unsettling_description: The sapient flesh is deliciously chewy.
original_description: It's so chewy.

name: Strange Bun
unsettling_description: What's inside? OH SWEET YOBA IT'S SPIDERS!
original_description: What's inside?

name: Lucky Lunch
unsettling_description: So tasty that luck-bringing spirits will nest in your belly to eat it.
original_description: A special little meal.

name: Fried Mushroom
unsettling_description: You can still taste the dirt.
original_description: Earthy and aromatic.

name: Pizza
original_description: It's popular for all the right reasons.

name: Bean Hotpot
original_description: It sure is healthy.

name: Glazed Yams
unsettling_description: If you can't stomach eating your vegetables, drown them in sugar first.
original_description: Sweet and satisfying... The sugar gives it a hint of caramel.

name: Carp Surprise
unsettling_description: The carp is not the surprising part of this meal.
original_description: It's bland and oily.

name: Hashbrowns
original_description: Crispy and golden-brown!

name: Pancakes
original_description: A double stack of fluffy, soft pancakes.

name: Salmon Dinner
unsettling_description: Cooked flesh of a fish with a squirt of something yellow... thats what makes it special. ;)
original_description: The lemon spritz makes it special.

name: Fish Taco
unsettling_description: A fishy smell is normal for this taco.
original_description: It smells delicious.

name: Crispy Bass
original_description: Wow, the breading is perfect.

name: Pepper Poppers
original_description: Spicy breaded peppers filled with cheese.

name: Bread
unsettling_description: The greatest thing since the elves disappeared.
original_description: A crusty baguette.

name: Tom Kha Soup
original_description: These flavors are incredible!

name: Trout Soup
original_description: Pretty salty.

name: Chocolate Cake
original_description: Rich and moist with a thick fudge icing.

name: Pink Cake
original_description: There's little heart candies on top.

name: Rhubarb Pie
original_description: Mmm, tangy and sweet!

name: Cookie
original_description: Very chewy.

name: Spaghetti
original_description: An old favorite.

name: Fried Eel
unsettling_description: Greasy on the outside and mushy on the inside. At least it's no longer slimy.
original_description: Greasy but flavorful.

name: Spicy Eel
original_description: It's really spicy! Be careful.

name: Sashimi
original_description: Raw fish sliced into thin pieces.

name: Maki Roll
original_description: Fish and rice wrapped in seaweed.

name: Tortilla
original_description: Can be used as a vessel for food or eaten by itself.

name: Red Plate
original_description: Full of antioxidants.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
original_description: Tangy, cheesy, and wonderful.

name: Rice Pudding
original_description: It's creamy, sweet, and fun to eat.

name: Ice Cream
unsettling_description: The taste brings to mind screaming children.
original_description: It's hard to find someone who doesn't like this.

name: Blueberry Tart
original_description: It's subtle and refreshing.

name: Autumn's Bounty
original_description: A taste of the season.

name: Pumpkin Soup
original_description: A seasonal favorite.

name: Super Meal
original_description: It's a really energizing meal.

name: Cranberry Sauce
unsettling_description: The gelatinized corpses of countless cranberries. How could you?!
original_description: A festive treat.

name: Stuffing
unsettling_description: Oh, you'll be stuffed, all right.
original_description: Ahh... the smell of warm bread and sage.

name: Farmer's Lunch
original_description: This'll keep you going.

name: Survival Burger
unsettling_description: A vegetarian alternative for the health-conscious cannibal.
original_description: A convenient snack for the explorer.

name: Dish O' The Sea
original_description: This'll keep you warm in the cold sea air.

name: Miner's Treat
original_description: This should keep your energy up.

name: Roots Platter
original_description: This'll get you digging for more.

name: Sugar
original_description: Adds sweetness to pastries and candies. Too much can be unhealthy.

name: Wheat Flour
original_description: A common cooking ingredient made from crushed wheat seeds.

name: Oil
unsettling_description: A vital ingredient in fried food and clogged arteries.
original_description: All purpose cooking oil.

name: Garlic
original_description: Adds a wonderful zestiness to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.

name: Kale
original_description: The waxy leaves are great in soups and stir frys.

name: Tea Sapling
original_description: Takes 20 days to mature. Produces tea leaves during the final week of each season, except winter. No watering necessary!

name: Rhubarb
original_description: The stalks are extremely tart, but make a great dessert when sweetened.

name: Triple Shot Espresso
unsettling_description: Causes irregular or rapid heartbeat in high doses. Just ignore it, it's probably fine.
original_description: It's more potent than regular coffee!

name: Melon
original_description: A cool, sweet summer treat.

name: Tomato
unsettling_description: Belongs to the nightshade family, but don't worry, it's not poisonous.
original_description: Rich and slightly tangy, the Tomato has a wide variety of culinary uses.

name: Morel
original_description: Sought after for its unique nutty flavor.

name: Blueberry
original_description: A popular berry reported to have many health benefits. The blue skin has the highest nutrient concentration.

name: Fiddlehead Fern
original_description: The young shoots are an edible specialty.

name: Hot Pepper
original_description: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.

name: Warp Totem: Desert
unsettling_description: Warps all time and space to re-center Calico Desert on your current physical location. Consumed on use.
original_description: Warp directly to Calico Desert. Consumed on use.

name: Wheat
original_description: One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes.

name: Radish
original_description: A crisp and refreshing root vegetable with hints of pepper when eaten raw.

name: Red Cabbage
original_description: Often used in salads and coleslaws. The color can range from purple to blue to green-yellow depending on soil conditions.

name: Starfruit
original_description: An extremely juicy fruit that grows in hot, humid weather. Slightly sweet with a sour undertone.

name: Corn
original_description: One of the most popular grains. The sweet, fresh cobs are a summer favorite.

name: Unmilled Rice
unsettling_description: May cause avian stomachs to explode when eaten.
original_description: Rice in its rawest form. Run this through a mill to increase the value.

name: Eggplant
original_description: A rich and wholesome relative of the tomato. Delicious fried or stewed.

name: Rice Shoot
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 8 days to mature. Grows faster if planted near a body of water. Harvest with the scythe.

name: Artichoke
original_description: The bud of a thistle plant. The spiny outer leaves conceal a fleshy, filling interior.

name: Artifact Trove
unsettling_description: Be careful breaking this open. You could get an artifact... or unleash a very angry specter.
original_description: A blacksmith can open this for you. These troves often contain ancient relics and curiosities.

name: Pumpkin
original_description: A fall favorite, grown for its crunchy seeds and delicately flavored flesh. As a bonus, the hollow shell can be carved into a festive decoration.

name: Wilted Bouquet
original_description: A gift that shows you want to stop dating someone.

name: Bok Choy
original_description: The leafy greens and fibrous stalks are healthy and delicious.

name: Magic Rock Candy
unsettling_description: Colorful candy made from literal rocks. Seems like something meant to trick children.
original_description: A rare and powerful candy infused with the essence of the prismatic shard.

name: Yam
original_description: A starchy tuber with a lot of culinary versatility.

name: Chanterelle
original_description: A tasty mushroom with a fruity smell and slightly peppery flavor.

name: Cranberries
original_description: These tart red berries are a traditional winter food.

name: Holly
unsettling_description: Crisp and juicy berries. Alas, some things are only edible once.
original_description: The leaves and bright red berries make a popular winter decoration.

name: Beet
original_description: A sweet and earthy root vegatable. As a bonus, the leaves make a great salad.

name: Cherry Bomb
unsettling_description: A small explosive device that is unfortunately tempting for small children.
original_description: Generates a small explosion. Stand back!

name: Bomb
unsettling_description: A civilian version of a mass-produced explosive from the Gotoro war.
original_description: Generates an explosion. Watch out!

name: Mega Bomb
unsettling_description: A devastatingly powerful bomb intended to inflict maximum damage and harm.
original_description: Generates a powerful explosion. Use with extreme caution.

name: Brick Floor
unsettling_description: Chunks of brick can make decent weapons, in a pinch. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to decorate your floors.

name: Salmonberry
unsettling_description: The color is eerily similar to salmon... eggs.
original_description: A spring-time berry with the flavor of the forest.

name: Grass Starter
unsettling_description: Plant this for your animals to eat. When you scythe it, you can smell the grass screaming in pain as it dies.
original_description: Place this on your farm to start a new patch of grass.

name: Hardwood Fence
unsettling_description: Makes a stronger prison than an iron fence.
original_description: The most durable type of fence.

name: Amaranth Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to grow. Harvest with the scythe.

name: Amaranth
unsettling_description: A purple grain like a thousand years old. Good luck actually enjoying this dust.
original_description: A purple grain cultivated by an ancient civilization.

name: Grape Starter
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in fall, 10 days, reharvestable. Trellis crop.
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

name: Hops Starter
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in summer, 11 days, reharvestable. Trellis crop.
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

name: Pale Ale
unsettling_description: Drink before and after driving a bus if your name is Pam.
original_description: Drink in moderation.

name: Hops
original_description: A bitter, tangy flower used to flavor beer.

name: Void Egg
unsettling_description: Might give birth to the Darkness itself. Do you dare to let it hatch?
original_description: A jet-black egg with red flecks. It's warm to the touch.

name: Mayonnaise
unsettling_description: Technically an oily egg yolk. Someone came up with this great idea!
original_description: It looks spreadable.

name: Duck Mayonnaise
unsettling_description: Spreadable essence of unborn duck. Goes great in sandwiches.
original_description: It's a rich, yellow mayonnaise.

name: Void Mayonnaise
unsettling_description: Your mortal, dimensionally finite stomach cannot hope to endure its unfathomable nutrients.
original_description: A thick, black paste that smells like burnt hair.

name: Acorn
original_description: Place this on your farm to plant an oak tree.

name: Maple Seed
unsettling_description: A winged tree seed that bears uncanny resemblance to an insect.
original_description: Place this on your farm to plant a maple tree.

name: Pine Cone
unsettling_description: Tiny ants crawl between the rough scales.
original_description: Place this on your farm to plant a pine tree.

name: Wood Fence
original_description: Keeps grass and animals contained!

name: Stone Fence
unsettling_description: Makes a stronger prison than a wood fence.
original_description: Lasts longer than a wood fence.

name: Iron Fence
unsettling_description: Makes a stronger prison than a stone fence.
original_description: Lasts longer than a stone fence.

name: Gate
original_description: Allows you to pass through a fence.

name: Dwarvish Translation Guide
original_description: Teaches you dwarvish.

name: Wood Floor
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to decorate your floors.

name: Stone Floor
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Clay
unsettling_description: Not very tasty, 0 out of 10. (2 out of 10 with rice)
original_description: Used in crafting and construction.

name: Weathered Floor
unsettling_description: Deliberately crafted to give a haunted look. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Crystal Floor
unsettling_description: Has an unnaturally smooth surface. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Copper Bar
original_description: A bar of pure copper.

name: Iron Bar
original_description: A bar of pure iron.

name: Gold Bar
original_description: A bar of pure gold.

name: Iridium Bar
original_description: A bar of pure iridium.

name: Refined Quartz
original_description: A more pure form of quartz.

name: Honey
unsettling_description: Bee spit. The bees use it to feed their young, so it should be fine for human consumption, right?
original_description: It's a sweet syrup produced by bees.

name: Tea Set
original_description: Fine porcelain.

name: Pickles
unsettling_description: Jar of soggy vegetables left to cure in a pool of brine.
original_description: A jar of your home-made pickles.

name: Stone
original_description: Stone.

name: Jelly
original_description: Gooey.

name: Beer
unsettling_description: Mm, you can really taste how old this liquid is!
original_description: Drink in moderation.

name: Rare Seed
original_description: Sow in fall. Takes all season to grow.

name: Wine
original_description: Drink in moderation.

name: Energy Tonic
unsettling_description: This drug will give you the 'youthful' energy to go all night long!
original_description: Restores a lot of energy.

name: Juice
unsettling_description: Life-blood squeezed from vegetables for easy-to-drink vitamins!
original_description: A sweet, nutritious beverage.

name: Muscle Remedy
original_description: When you've pushed your body too hard, drink this to remove 'Exhaustion'.

name: Basic Fertilizer
unsettling_description: Your crops have a slight chance to grow larger in soil sprinkled with tree blood.
original_description: Improves soil quality a little, increasing your chance to grow quality crops. Mix into tilled soil.

name: Quality Fertilizer
unsettling_description: Improves the chance of higher quality harvests by repurposing dead fish.
original_description: Improves soil quality, increasing your chance to grow quality crops. Mix into tilled soil.

name: Basic Retaining Soil
original_description: This soil has a chance of staying watered overnight. Mix into tilled soil.

name: Quality Retaining Soil
original_description: This soil has a good chance of staying watered overnight. Mix into tilled soil.

name: Clam
unsettling_description: Taking home invasion to new heights.
original_description: Someone lived here once.

name: Golden Pumpkin
original_description: It's valuable but has no other purpose.

name: Copper Ore
unsettling_description: Choking hazard: Not for children under 3 years.
original_description: A common ore that can be smelted into bars.

name: Iron Ore
original_description: A fairly common ore that can be smelted into bars.

name: Coal
unsettling_description: A bit of magic and fire has turned old bones to coal. Should be safe to use.
original_description: A combustible rock that is useful for crafting and smelting.

name: Gold Ore
original_description: A precious ore that can be smelted into bars.

name: Iridium Ore
original_description: An exotic ore with many curious properties. Can be smelted into bars.

name: Wood
original_description: A sturdy, yet flexible plant material with a wide variety of uses.

name: Stone
unsettling_description: The most ancient and versatile of all weapons and tools.
original_description: A common material with many uses in crafting and building.

name: Nautilus Shell
original_description: An ancient shell.

name: Coral
original_description: A colony of tiny creatures that clump together to form beautiful structures.

name: Rainbow Shell
original_description: It's a very beautiful shell.

name: Coffee
unsettling_description: Brown, bitter liquid made from straining hot water through burnt, pulverized seeds.
original_description: It smells delicious. This is sure to give you a boost.

name: Spice Berry
unsettling_description: Contains orbs of pungent flesh that burst when prodded.
original_description: It fills the air with a pungent aroma.

name: Sea Urchin
original_description: A slow-moving, spiny creature that some consider a delicacy.

name: Grape
unsettling_description: With skins peeled they feel like wet eyeballs.
original_description: A sweet cluster of fruit.

name: Spring Onion
original_description: These grow wild during the spring.

name: Strawberry
original_description: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

name: Straw Floor
unsettling_description: Toss dead grass around for a nice fall look.
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Sweet Pea
original_description: A fragrant summer flower.

name: Field Snack
original_description: A quick snack to fuel the hungry forager.

name: Common Mushroom
unsettling_description: Someday they will decompose *your* remains. If you must eat, chew gently.
original_description: Slightly nutty, with good texture.

name: Wood Path
unsettling_description: Decorate with milled tree carcasses. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Wild Plum
original_description: Tart and juicy with a pungent aroma.

name: Gravel Path
unsettling_description: Small, sharp rocks to step on. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Hazelnut
original_description: That's one big hazelnut!

name: Crystal Path
unsettling_description: Falling on this surface risks a thousand cuts. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Blackberry
original_description: An early-fall treat.

name: Cobblestone Path
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Winter Root
original_description: A starchy tuber.

name: Blue Slime Egg
unsettling_description: You can see the embryo of a baby slime bouncing within. Hatch it in a slime incubator.
original_description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

name: Crystal Fruit
original_description: A delicate fruit that pops up from the snow.

name: Stepping Stone Path
original_description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

name: Snow Yam
original_description: This little yam was hiding beneath the snow.

name: Sweet Gem Berry
original_description: It's by far the sweetest thing you've ever smelled.

name: Crocus
original_description: A flower that can bloom in the winter.

name: Vinegar
original_description: An aged fermented liquid used in many cooking recipes.

name: Red Mushroom
unsettling_description: Poisonous. But fun to eat anyway.
original_description: A spotted mushroom sometimes found in caves.

name: Sunflower
original_description: A common misconception is that the flower turns so it's always facing the sun.

name: Purple Mushroom
unsettling_description: Brightly colored. They say this one isn't poisonous, so it should be safe to eat.
original_description: A rare mushroom found deep in caves.

name: Rice
original_description: A basic grain often served under vegetables.

name: Cheese
unsettling_description: Cow milk exposed to bacteria and allowed to curdle. Eat up!
original_description: It's your basic cheese.

name: Goat Cheese
unsettling_description: Squishy, congealed milk from a goat's udder. Considered a delicacy by many.
original_description: Soft cheese made from goat's milk.

name: Cloth
original_description: A bolt of fine wool cloth.

name: Truffle
original_description: A gourmet type of mushroom with a unique taste.

name: Truffle Oil
original_description: A gourmet cooking ingredient.

name: Coffee Bean
unsettling_description: Grows in spring and summer; reharvestable. Whatever you do, don't stuff it up your nose.
original_description: Plant in spring or summer to grow a coffee plant. Place five beans in a keg to make coffee.

name: Stardrop
original_description: A mysterious fruit that empowers those who eat it. The flavor is like a dream... a powerful personal experience, yet difficult to describe to others.

name: Goat Milk
unsettling_description: If cow lactations aren't your thing, try this variant!
original_description: The milk of a goat.

name: Red Slime Egg
unsettling_description: It only takes 100 slime carcasses to make one of these. Hatch it in a slime incubator.
original_description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

name: L. Goat Milk
unsettling_description: The goat's swollen udder must feel much better after squeezing all of this out.
original_description: A gallon of creamy goat's milk.

name: Purple Slime Egg
unsettling_description: A developing youngling of the most dangerous variety of slime monster. Hatch it in a slime incubator.
original_description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

name: Wool
unsettling_description: That sheep will be cold and shivering, but sure, enjoy how soft this is!
original_description: Soft, fluffy wool.

name: Explosive Ammo
unsettling_description: Owing to improper storage, it causes hundreds of unfortunate child deaths each year.
original_description: Fire this with the slingshot.

name: Duck Egg
original_description: It's still warm.

name: Duck Feather
unsettling_description: This exquisite feather was plucked out of a duck's butt.
original_description: It's so colorful.

name: Rabbit's Foot
unsettling_description: A successful amputation from a peculiar rabbit species that seems to regrow lost feet.
original_description: Some say it's lucky.

name: Aged Roe
unsettling_description: Aged fish fetuses covered in a thick, gooey substance. The salt brings out the flavor.
original_description: Fish eggs aged in salt to bring out the flavor.

name: Stone Base
original_description: A simple block of stone.

name: Stone
original_description: Stone.

name: Weeds
original_description: A cluster of dry old bushes.

name: Ancient Fruit
unsettling_description: There's no evidence to confirm that this fruit could harbor an ancient, long-dormant disease.
original_description: It's been dormant for eons.

name: Algae Soup
unsettling_description: It's a 'little' slimy. As in 'slimy to the point where you're eating more slime than soup'.
original_description: It's a little slimy.

name: Pale Broth
unsettling_description: Very similar to algae soup with the additional flavour of rotten eggs.
original_description: A delicate broth with a hint of sulfur.

name: Bouquet
unsettling_description: A colorful bunch of severed plant reproductive organs. Maybe your sweetheart will get the hint?
original_description: A gift that shows your romantic interest.

name: Mead
original_description: A fermented beverage made from honey. Drink in moderation.

name: Mermaid's Pendant
unsettling_description: A ghost ripped this from a mermaid so you can woo your lover.
original_description: Give this to the person you want to marry.

name: Decorative Pot
original_description: A replica of an ancient pot.

name: Drum Block
unsettling_description: Beating this to a specific pattern might just awaken the wrong god.
original_description: Plays a drum sound when you walk past.

name: Flute Block
unsettling_description: Go ahead. Play your haunting melodies, see what happens.
original_description: Plays a flute sound when you walk past.

name: Speed-Gro
unsettling_description: Increases growth rate by at least 10%. You have to wonder if this would work on other things.
original_description: Stimulates leaf production. Guaranteed to increase growth rate by at least 10%. Mix into tilled soil.

name: Deluxe Speed-Gro
unsettling_description: TODO Increases growth rate by at least 25%.
original_description: Stimulates leaf production. Guaranteed to increase growth rate by at least 25%. Mix into tilled soil.

name: Parsnip Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.

name: Bean Starter
unsettling_description: It doesn't *feel* magical, but you never know. Plant in spring, 10 days, reharvestable. Trellis crop.
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

name: Cauliflower Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 12 days to produce a large cauliflower.

name: Potato Seeds
unsettling_description: The package says "seeds", but these are clearly potato eyes. Plant in spring, 6 days. Chance for multiple harvest.
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature, and has a chance of yielding multiple potatoes at harvest.

name: Garlic Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.

name: Kale Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in spring, 6 days. Harvest with scythe.
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.

name: Rhubarb Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 13 days to mature.

name: Melon Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 12 days to mature.

name: Tomato Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in summer, 11 days, reharvestable.
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

name: Blueberry Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in summer, 13 days, reharvestable.
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 13 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

name: Pepper Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in summer, 5 days, reharvestable.
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

name: Wheat Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in summer or fall, 4 days. Harvest with scythe.
original_description: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.

name: Radish Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 6 days to mature.

name: Red Cabbage Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 9 days to mature.

name: Starfruit Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 13 days to mature.

name: Corn Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in summer or fall, 14 days, reharvestable.
original_description: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 14 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

name: Eggplant Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in fall, 5 days, reharvestable.
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

name: Artichoke Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 8 days to mature.

name: Pumpkin Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 13 days to mature.

name: Bok Choy Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 4 days to mature.

name: Yam Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to mature.

name: Cranberry Seeds
unsettling_description: TODO Plant in fall, 7 days, reharvestable.
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

name: Beet Seeds
original_description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 6 days to mature.

name: Spring Seeds
original_description: An assortment of wild spring seeds.

name: Summer Seeds
original_description: An assortment of wild summer seeds.

name: Fall Seeds
original_description: An assortment of wild fall seeds.

name: Winter Seeds
original_description: An assortment of wild winter seeds.

name: Ancient Seeds
original_description: Could these still grow?

name: Tulip Bulb
original_description: Plant in spring. Takes 6 days to produce a colorful flower. Assorted colors.

name: Jazz Seeds
original_description: Plant in spring. Takes 7 days to produce a blue puffball flower.

name: Poppy Seeds
original_description: Plant in summer. Produces a bright red flower in 7 days.

name: Spangle Seeds
original_description: Plant in summer. Takes 8 days to produce a vibrant tropical flower. Assorted colors.

name: Sunflower Seeds
original_description: Plant in summer or fall. Takes 8 days to produce a large sunflower. Yields more seeds at harvest.

name: Fairy Seeds
original_description: Plant in fall. Takes 12 days to produce a mysterious flower. Assorted Colors.

name: Small Glow Ring
unsettling_description: You wonder where the light comes from. Could this ring be radioactive?
original_description: Emits a small, constant light.

name: Glow Ring
unsettling_description: Emits a strong, constant light. Wearing it makes your head feel funny...
original_description: Emits a constant light.

name: Small Magnet Ring
unsettling_description: Makes you a little more alluring to the objects in your surroundings.
original_description: Slightly increases your radius for collecting items.

name: Magnet Ring
unsettling_description: Everything is fiercely attracted to you. You're just that irresistible.
original_description: Increases your radius for collecting items.

name: Slime Charmer Ring
unsettling_description: You won't feel a thing from the slimes' touch. ;)
original_description: Prevents damage from slimes.

name: Warrior Ring
unsettling_description: The sharp edges cut into your flesh, making this ring difficult to remove. But it makes you feel stronger...
original_description: Occasionally infuses the wearer with "warrior energy" after slaying a monster.

name: Vampire Ring
unsettling_description: It can steal the life-force of any being; hopefully not your own.
original_description: Gain a little health every time you slay a monster.

name: Savage Ring
unsettling_description: Wearing this ring overwhelms you with a sudden blood-lust.
original_description: Gain a short speed boost whenever you slay a monster.

name: Ring of Yoba
unsettling_description: Lets Yoba watch over you as you fight. Maybe just a little too closely...
original_description: Occasionally shields the wearer from damage.

name: Sturdy Ring
original_description: Cuts the duration of negative status effects in half.

name: Burglar's Ring
unsettling_description: Improves your skills of thievery from corpses.
original_description: Monsters have a greater chance of dropping loot.

name: Iridium Band
unsettling_description: Just as uncomfortable as it looks.
original_description: Glows, attracts items, and increases attack damage by 10%.

name: Jukebox Ring
original_description: Plays a random assortment of music you've heard.

name: Amethyst Ring
unsettling_description: Push everything and everyone further away from you.
original_description: Increases knockback by 10%.

name: Topaz Ring
unsettling_description: Gleams yellow when worn; an unseen force adjusts the movements of your hand.
original_description: Increases weapon precision by 10%.

name: Aquamarine Ring
original_description: Increases critical strike chance by 10%.

name: Jade Ring
original_description: Increases critical strike power by 10%.

name: Emerald Ring
unsettling_description: Kill things faster than ever before.
original_description: Increases weapon speed by 10%.

name: Ruby Ring
original_description: Increases attack by 10%.

name: Geode
unsettling_description: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within.
original_description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

name: Frozen Geode
unsettling_description: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within.
original_description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

name: Magma Geode
unsettling_description: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within.
original_description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

name: Alamite
original_description: Its distinctive fluorescence makes it a favorite among rock collectors.

name: Bixite
original_description: A dark metallic Mineral sought after for its cubic structure.

name: Baryte
original_description: The best specimens resemble a desert rose.

name: Aerinite
original_description: These crystals are curiously light.

name: Calcite
original_description: This yellow crystal is speckled with shimmering nodules.

name: Dolomite
original_description: It can occur in coral reefs, often near an underwater volcano.

name: Esperite
unsettling_description: The crystals glow bright green when stimulated. Stimulated how?
original_description: The crystals glow bright green when stimulated.

name: Fluorapatite
unsettling_description: Small amounts are found in human teeth. Tiny crystals... growing... in your mouth bones...
original_description: Small amounts are found in human teeth.

name: Geminite
original_description: Occurs in brilliant clusters.

name: Helvite
original_description: It grows in a triangular column.

name: Jamborite
original_description: The crystals are so tightly packed it almost looks fuzzy.

name: Jagoite
original_description: A high volume of tiny crystals makes it very glittery.

name: Kyanite
original_description: The geometric faces are as smooth as glass.

name: Lunarite
original_description: The cratered white orbs form a tight cluster.

name: Malachite
unsettling_description: A toxic mineral. Please do not insert it into any orifices.
original_description: A popular ornamental stone, used in sculpture and to make green paint.

name: Neptunite
unsettling_description: Reflected in its jet-black surface you can see your face... and another face behind you.
original_description: A jet-black crystal that is unusually reflective.

name: Lemon Stone
unsettling_description: Dwarves are said to use the powdered crystal both medicinally and recreationally.
original_description: Some claim the powdered crystal is a dwarvish delicacy.

name: Nekoite
original_description: The delicate shards form a tiny pink meadow.

name: Orpiment
unsettling_description: An attractive variety of arsenic mineral. Used in folk medicine, but highly toxic.
original_description: Despite its high toxicity, this Mineral is widely used in manufacturing and folk medicine.

name: Petrified Slime
unsettling_description: This slime has seen some things. It's best we leave it this way.
original_description: This little guy may be 100,000 years old.

name: Thunder Egg
original_description: According to legend, angry thunder spirits would throw these stones at one another.

name: Pyrite
unsettling_description: Did you think this was gold? Sucker!
original_description: Commonly known as "Fool's Gold".

name: Ocean Stone
original_description: An old legend claims these stones are the mosaics of ancient mermaids.

name: Ghost Crystal
unsettling_description: You hear strange moans in the distance when holding this crystal.
original_description: There is an aura of coldness around this crystal.

name: Tigerseye
unsettling_description: Some poor tiger was blinded for this...
original_description: A stripe of shimmering gold gives this gem a warm luster.

name: Jasper
original_description: When polished, this stone becomes attactively luminous. Prized by ancient peoples for thousands of years.

name: Opal
original_description: Its internal structure causes it to reflect a rainbow of light.

name: Fire Opal
original_description: A rare variety of opal, named for its red spots.

name: Celestine
original_description: Some early life forms had bones made from this.

name: Marble
original_description: A very popular material for sculptures and construction.

name: Sandstone
original_description: A common type of stone with red and brown striations.

name: Granite
original_description: A speckled Mineral that is commonly used in construction.

name: Basalt
original_description: Forms near searing hot magma.

name: Limestone
unsettling_description: Heat it at high temperatures to produce a compound helpful for disposing of human remains.
original_description: A very common type of stone. It's not worth very much.

name: Soapstone
unsettling_description: This stone can be easily carved into all sorts of tempting shapes.
original_description: Because of its relatively soft consistency, this stone is very popular for carving.

name: Hematite
original_description: An iron-based Mineral with interesting magnetic properties.

name: Mudstone
original_description: A fine-grained rock made from ancient clay or mud.

name: Obsidian
unsettling_description: Can be crafted into thin blades much sharper than glass. Useful for surgeries.
original_description: A volcanic glass that forms when lava cools rapidly.

name: Slate
original_description: It's extremely resistant to water, making it a good roofing material.

name: Fairy Stone
original_description: An old miner's song suggests these are made from the bones of ancient fairies.

name: Star Shards
original_description: No one knows how these form. Some scientists claim that the microscopic structure displays unnatural regularity.

name: Prehistoric Scapula
original_description: Commonly known as a "shoulder blade"... It's unclear what species it belonged to.

name: Prehistoric Tibia
original_description: A thick and sturdy leg bone.

name: Prehistoric Skull
original_description: This is definitely a mammalian skull.

name: Skeletal Hand
unsettling_description: This bone's age is about one thous... Oh! ...Oh no. It's much more recent.
original_description: It's a wonder all these ancient little pieces lasted so long.

name: Prehistoric Rib
original_description: Little gouge marks on the side suggest that this rib was someone's dinner.

name: Prehistoric Vertebra
original_description: A segment of some prehistoric creature's spine.

name: Skeletal Tail
original_description: It's pretty short for a tail.

name: Nautilus Fossil
unsettling_description: Better to collect fossils than the actual creature. They're almost extinct.
original_description: This must've washed up ages ago from an ancient coral reef.

name: Amphibian Fossil
unsettling_description: Formed eons ago when a small creature fell into a mud pit and was swallowed alive by the dirt.
original_description: The relatively short hind legs suggest some kind of primordial toad.

name: Palm Fossil
original_description: Palm Fossils are relatively common, but this happens to be a particularly well-preserved specimen.

name: Trilobite
original_description: A long extinct relative of the crab.

name: Artifact Spot
original_description: Uh... how did you get this in your inventory? Ape made a booboo.

name: Tulip
original_description: The most popular spring flower. Has a very faint sweet smell.

name: Summer Spangle
original_description: A tropical bloom that thrives in the humid summer air. Has a sweet, tangy aroma.

name: Fairy Rose
original_description: An old folk legend suggests that the sweet smell of this flower attracts fairies.

name: Blue Jazz
original_description: The flower grows in a sphere to invite as many butterflies as possible.

name: Sprinkler
unsettling_description: Spits on the 4 adjacent tiles every morning.
original_description: Waters the 4 adjacent tiles every morning.

name: Poppy
unsettling_description: A sweet-smelling flower thought to symbolize death. Breathing its scent is almost addictive...
original_description: In addition to its colorful flower, the Poppy has culinary and medicinal uses.

name: Plum Pudding
unsettling_description: Every proper holiday needs a flaming dessert.
original_description: A traditional holiday treat.

name: Artichoke Dip
original_description: It's cool and refreshing.

name: Stir Fry
original_description: Julienned vegetables on a bed of rice.

name: Roasted Hazelnuts
original_description: The roasting process creates a rich forest flavor.

name: Pumpkin Pie
original_description: Silky pumpkin cream in a flakey crust.

name: Radish Salad
original_description: The radishes are so crisp!

name: Fruit Salad
original_description: A delicious combination of summer fruits.

name: Blackberry Cobbler
original_description: There's nothing quite like it.

name: Cranberry Candy
original_description: It's sweet enough to mask the bitter fruit.

name: Apple
unsettling_description: How many worms are in this one?
original_description: A crisp fruit used for juice and cider.

name: Green Tea
unsettling_description: A highly diluted mixture of shrub and water. Yum!
original_description: A pleasant, energizing beverage made from lightly processed tea leaves.

name: Bruschetta
original_description: Roasted tomatoes on a crisp white bread.

name: Quality Sprinkler
original_description: Waters the 8 adjacent tiles every morning.

name: Iridium Sprinkler
original_description: Waters the 24 adjacent tiles every morning.

name: Coleslaw
unsettling_description: It's very "healthy". Tastes like eating sliced up cardboard with mayonnaise.
original_description: It's light, fresh and very healthy.

name: Fiddlehead Risotto
original_description: A creamy rice dish served with sauteed fern heads. It's a little bland.

name: Poppyseed Muffin
unsettling_description: It has a soothing effect, just like the opium that can be derived from poppy seeds.
original_description: It has a soothing effect.

name: Cherry Sapling
original_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature cherry tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

name: Apricot Sapling
original_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Apricot tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

name: Orange Sapling
original_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Orange tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

name: Peach Sapling
original_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Peach tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

name: Pomegranate Sapling
original_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pomegranate tree. Bears fruit in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

name: Apple Sapling
original_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Apple tree. Bears fruit in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

name: Apricot
unsettling_description: Take care not to choke on the hard pit.
original_description: A tender little fruit with a rock-hard pit.

name: Orange
original_description: Juicy, tangy, and bursting with sweet summer aroma.

name: Peach
unsettling_description: Fuzzy to the touch with soft, sweet flesh underneath.
original_description: It's almost fuzzy to the touch.

name: Pomegranate
unsettling_description: A known aphrodisiac with an inside texture like tiny, crunchy eyeballs.
original_description: Within the fruit are clusters of juicy seeds.

name: Cherry
unsettling_description: A popular modder known for creating Train Station mod and Shop Tile Framework.
original_description: It's popular, and ripens sooner than most other fruits.

name: Stone
original_description: There's stone ore in this stone.

name: Stone
original_description: There's stone ore in this stone.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Green Slime Egg
unsettling_description: It squirms within your grasp, the embryo eagerly awaiting release. Hatch it in a slime incubator.
original_description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

name: Rain Totem
unsettling_description: Activate it to play god and wreck havoc on natural weather patterns. Consumed on use.
original_description: Activate to greatly increase the chance for rain tomorrow. Consumed on use.

name: Mutant Carp
original_description: The strange waters of the sewer turned this carp into a monstrosity.

name: Bug Meat
unsettling_description: Throw this on the grill for a late night treat!
original_description: It's a juicy wad of bug flesh.

name: Bait
unsettling_description: Large bugs, slain and minced to lure in more critters for food.
original_description: Causes fish to bite faster. Must first be attached to a fishing rod.

name: Spinner
original_description: The shape makes it spin around in the water. Slightly increases the bite-rate when fishing.

name: Dressed Spinner
original_description: The metal tab and colorful streamers create an enticing spectacle for fish. Increases the bite-rate when fishing.

name: Warp Totem: Farm
unsettling_description: Warps all time and space to re-center the farm on your current physical location. Consumed on use.
original_description: Warp directly to your house. Consumed on use.

name: Warp Totem: Mountains
unsettling_description: Warps all time and space to re-center the mountains on your current physical location. Consumed on use.
original_description: Warp directly to the mountains. Consumed on use.

name: Warp Totem: Beach
unsettling_description: Warps all time and space to re-center the beach on your current physical location. Consumed on use.
original_description: Warp directly to the beach. Consumed on use.

name: Barbed Hook
unsettling_description: Stab the fish when they bite the hook, stab them again when they try to wiggle free.
original_description: Makes your catch more secure, causing the "fishing bar" to cling to your catch. Works best on slow, weak fish.

name: Lead Bobber
original_description: Adds weight to your "fishing bar", preventing it from bouncing along the bottom.

name: Treasure Hunter
original_description: Fish don't escape while collecting treasures. Also slightly increases the chance to find treasures.

name: Trap Bobber
unsettling_description: Helps thwart a hooked fish's efforts to escape.
original_description: Causes fish to escape slower when you aren't reeling them in.

name: Cork Bobber
original_description: Slightly increases the size of your "fishing bar".

name: Sturgeon
unsettling_description: Slow-breeding bottom-feeder close to extinction. Now there's one less in the wild, courtesy of you.
original_description: An ancient bottom-feeder with a dwindling population. Females can live up to 150 years.

name: Tiger Trout
unsettling_description: Doomed to be the last of their bloodline, these unnatural hybrids can never reproduce.
original_description: A rare hybrid trout that cannot bear offspring of its own.

name: Bullhead
original_description: A relative of the catfish that eats a variety of foods off the lake bottom.

name: Tilapia
original_description: A primarily vegetarian fish that prefers warm water.

name: Chub
unsettling_description: This freshwater fish is at half-mast.
original_description: A common freshwater fish known for its voracious appetite.

name: Magnet
original_description: Increases the chance of finding treasures when fishing. However, fish aren't crazy about the taste.

name: Dorado
original_description: A fierce carnivore with brilliant orange scales.

name: Albacore
original_description: Prefers temperature "edges" where cool and warm water meet.

name: Shad
original_description: Lives in a school at sea, but returns to the rivers to spawn.

name: Lingcod
original_description: A fearsome predator that will eat almost anything it can cram into its mouth.

name: Halibut
unsettling_description: Born with an eye on each side of its head, one eye slowly migrates across as it grows.
original_description: A flat fish that lives on the ocean floor.

name: Hardwood
unsettling_description: A formidable length of hardened wood. Very pleasing to the touch.
original_description: A special kind of wood with superior strength and beauty.

name: Crab Pot
original_description: Place it in the water, load it with bait, and check the next day to see if you've caught anything. Works in streams, lakes, and the ocean.

name: Lobster
original_description: A large ocean-dwelling crustacean with a strong tail.

name: Crayfish
original_description: A small freshwater relative of the lobster.

name: Crab
unsettling_description: A sea spider, ready to be boiled alive and eaten fresh.
original_description: A marine crustacean with two powerful pincers.

name: Cockle
original_description: A common saltwater clam.

name: Mussel
original_description: A common bivalve that often lives in clusters.

name: Shrimp
original_description: A scavenger that feeds off the ocean floor. Widely prized for its meat.

name: Snail
original_description: A wide-ranging mollusc that lives in a spiral shell.

name: Periwinkle
original_description: A tiny freshwater snail that lives in a blue shell.

name: Oyster
unsettling_description: A slimy-feeling shell means this creature is still alive.
original_description: Constantly filters water to find food. In the process, it removes dangerous toxins from the environment.

name: Maple Syrup
unsettling_description: The sweet life-blood of maple trees, extracted for consumption.
original_description: A sweet syrup with a unique flavor.

name: Oak Resin
unsettling_description: The innards of an oak tree, extracted and processed for use.
original_description: A sticky, fragrant substance derived from oak sap.

name: Pine Tar
original_description: A pungent substance derived from pine sap.

name: Chowder
original_description: A perfect way to warm yourself after a cold night at sea.

name: Lobster Bisque
unsettling_description: Some say you can hear the lobster scream as it is boiled alive. Others say it is just the sound of steam escaping.
original_description: This delicate soup is a secret family recipe of Willy's.

name: Fish Stew
original_description: It smells a lot like the sea. Tastes better, though.

name: Escargot
unsettling_description: It may have a fancy French name, but it's still just snails.
original_description: Butter-soaked snails cooked to perfection.

name: Maple Bar
original_description: It's a sweet doughnut topped with a rich maple glaze.

name: Crab Cakes
original_description: Crab, bread crumbs, and egg formed into patties then fried to a golden brown.

name: Shrimp Cocktail
original_description: A sumptuous appetizer made with freshly-caught shrimp.

name: Woodskip
original_description: A very sensitive fish that can only live in pools deep in the forest.

name: Strawberry Seeds
original_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature, and keeps producing strawberries after that.

name: Jack-O-Lantern
unsettling_description: Vegetable craniotomy victim. Place its leering skull in a visible location as a warning to others.
original_description: A whimsical fall decoration.

name: Rotten Plant
unsettling_description: Flies have laid eggs in the putrid mass. You should probably get rid of this.
original_description: Decomposing organic material. It's slimy and unpleasant.

name: Rotten Plant
unsettling_description: Something wriggles just under the surface. You should probably get rid of this.
original_description: Decomposing organic material. It's slimy and unpleasant.

name: Omni Geode
unsettling_description: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within. So many possibilities!
original_description: A blacksmith can break this open for you. These geodes contain a wide variety of Minerals.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Stone
original_description: There's copper ore in this stone.

name: Stone
original_description: gold ore

name: Stone
original_description: iridium ore

name: Slime
unsettling_description: You're not sure which organ this gelatinous substance is from.
original_description: A shimmering, gelatinous glob with no smell.

name: Bat Wing
unsettling_description: It's still twitching after being sliced off from the body.
original_description: The material is surprisingly delicate.

name: Solar Essence
unsettling_description: A warm remnant of Yoba's power.
original_description: The glowing face is warm to the touch.

name: Void Essence
original_description: It's quivering with dark energy.

name: Mixed Seeds
unsettling_description: There's a little bit of everything in here! Not just seeds... there's a few dead bugs and animal droppings, too.
original_description: There's a little bit of everything here. Plant them and see what grows!

name: Fiber
unsettling_description: Better check it for animal droppings.
original_description: Raw material sourced from plants.

name: Oil of Garlic
unsettling_description: You'll ooze garlic from every pore, producing a pungent odor that is frightful to weaker monsters.
original_description: Drink this and weaker monsters will avoid you.

name: Life Elixir
original_description: Restores health to full.

name: Wild Bait
unsettling_description: Bug corpses held together with Linus' special sauce.
original_description: A unique recipe from Linus that gives you a chance to catch two fish at once.

name: Glacierfish
original_description: Builds a nest on the underside of glaciers.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Battery Pack
original_description: It's fully charged with precious energy.

name: Lost Axe
unsettling_description: The axe cries out for its owner. Faintly you can hear it whisper, "Robin..."
original_description: Robin's been looking everywhere for it.

name: Lucky Purple Shorts
original_description: Better not inspect these too closely.

name: Berry Basket
unsettling_description: Stained with what you *hope* is berry juice. It smells like Linus, and he smells awful.
original_description: The fibers are stained with berry juice.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Weeds
original_description: Ugly weeds.

name: Void Salmon
unsettling_description: Shadows have mutated this species beyond repair. Keep an eye out behind you, you could be next.
original_description: A salmon, twisted by void energy. The fresh meat is jet black, but rapidly turns pink when exposed to air.

name: Slimejack
original_description: He's coated in a very thick layer of slime. He keeps slipping out of your hands!

name: Pearl
unsettling_description: A grain of sand that irritated an oyster until it spit on it again, and again, and again. Very beautiful.
original_description: A rare treasure from the sea.

name: Midnight Squid
original_description: A strange and mysterious denizen of the ocean's twilight depths.

name: Spook Fish
original_description: The huge eyes can detect the faint silhouettes of prey.

name: Blobfish
unsettling_description: A fish rapidly pulled from its deep-sea home. The changing pressures have almost turned it inside-out.
original_description: This odd creature floats above the ocean floor, consuming any edible material in its path.

name: Wedding Ring
unsettling_description: Binds your partner's soul to yours, 'til death do you part.
original_description: An old Zuzu City tradition... It's used to ask for another farmer's hand in marriage.

name: Cactus Seeds
unsettling_description: Grows a spiny plant with a nasty defense system. Plant indoors only, 12 days, reharvestable.
original_description: Can only be grown indoors. Takes 12 days to mature, and then produces fruit every 3 days.

name: Iridium Milk
original_description: A powerful 'milk' of unknown origin...

name: Tree Fertilizer
original_description: Sprinkle on a wild tree to ensure rapid growth, even in winter. Doesn't work on fruit trees.

name: Dinosaur Mayonnaise
original_description: It's thick and creamy, with a vivid green hue. It smells like grass and leather.

name: Void Ghost Pendant
original_description: It's symoblic to the shadow people. As a gift, it signifies the desire to move in together as friends.

name: Movie Ticket
unsettling_description: Sit with strangers in the dark and pretend the room isn't gassed up with farts. Give one to a friend!
original_description: Admits one to the movie theater. Giving this to a friend invites them to the movies with you.

name: Crabshell Ring
unsettling_description: The enchanted shell might protect you, but it certainly didn't protect the crab.
original_description: The top of the ring is made from enchanted crab shell.

name: Napalm Ring
unsettling_description: Explodes enemy corpses. Violently. Wear it on a finger!
original_description: When you defeat an enemy, they explode.

name: Roe
unsettling_description: You can see tiny baby fish inside. Alive and wiggling. Age them in a preserves jar to bring out more flavor.
original_description: Fresh fish eggs. These can be aged in a preserves jar to bring out more flavor.

name: Caviar
unsettling_description: The salted, unborn offspring of an endangered fish species. A luxurious delicacy!
original_description: The cured roe of a sturgeon fish. Considered to be a luxurious delicacy!

name: Squid Ink
original_description: Squid use this ink to confuse would-be predators.

name: Tea Leaves
original_description: The young leaves of the tea plant. Can be brewed into the popular, energizing beverage.

name: Flounder
unsettling_description: Two eyes on one side of its head and none on the other. It wasn't born that way.
original_description: It lives on the bottom, so both eyes are on top of its head.

name: Seafoam Pudding
unsettling_description: Waterlogged and briny. There's no going back if you eat this.
original_description: This briny pudding will really get you into the maritime mindset!

name: Midnight Carp
original_description: This shy fish only feels comfortable at night.
